title: Design Open Pit Slope Angles
description: A geotechnical engineer determines the steepest possible slope angles for an open pit mine that will still remain stable, to minimize the amount of waste rock that needs to be mined.

tasks.description: Gather all geotechnical data, including rock strength properties and the location of major geological structures.
tasks.expected_outcome: A complete geotechnical dataset is compiled.

tasks.description: Build a numerical model (e.g., using finite element or limit equilibrium methods) of the pit slope.
tasks.expected_outcome: A 2D or 3D model of the pit wall is created.

tasks.description: Run the model to calculate the 'Factor of Safety' for different slope angles. Select the steepest angle that still meets the required Factor of Safety (e.g., 1.3).
tasks.expected_outcome: The optimal inter-ramp slope angle is determined and provided to the long-term planners.
